page.title: 16DANGER ON THE ROADS
page.content: Most people think that cautionary notices should be used in the village in an attempt to reduce the speed of the traffic, although some doubt their eeffectiveness. There are many parts of the valley where the roads are felt to be dangerous. The majority of danger spots are within the village itself namely the corner by Lamperts farmhouse, East Street corner by Hit-or-Mis, the bend by Waterfall Cottage on the Dorchester Road and Chapel Bridge, the fork road leading to Cerne Abbas. On the valleey road the area around Magiston Farm enterance was considered dangerous. Parts of the road are in need of maintenance. Surface water is sometimes a hazard. There is an increasing number of heavy lorries using our roads.
